text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires describing the easing measures of the Windsor Framework by quoting at least three specific measures: \"trusted traders,\" \"not for EU\" labeling, and notional (conceptual) \"green lanes.\" The candidate answer explicitly details all three: Section 3.2 describes the \"Trusted Trader Scheme (TTS)\"; Section 2 describes the \"Green-lane goods\" which implies the 'not for EU' concept for goods staying in NI; and Section 3.1 details the \"Green lane\" vs \"Red lane\" system, which is the conceptual two-lane approach. The answer also quotes the definition of the Stormont Brake, although that was not explicitly required by this specific criterion, it shows comprehensive coverage. The description of the green lane clearly relates to goods 'not intended for the EU' market, satisfying the spirit of the 'not for EU' labeling requirement in context.", "criterion_id": "ccda598d-81f1-4df2-bf89-43523370149a"}
